pageContext.claim: “We are also taking dramatic action to make health insurance more affordable. We're allowing Americans to pool their resources to buy better healthcare for less money through association health plans. And that's really taken off.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump’s Labor Department has adopted a new rule to allow small businesses to band together to buy health-care plans as long as they share a “common geography or industry.” The Congressional Budget Office estimates that millions of people may switch over to these health plans, but there’s no evidence “millions of people are already signing up.” These plans won't be sold until September.
